category1.name: Action Oriented
category1.definition: Action-oriented leadership involves leading by example and getting things done as an individual, team and organization.

category1.name: People Oriented
category1.definition: Quality Relationships throughout the organization. Where companies value their employees and treat them as ‘family’.  They all get along, are pleasant and happy and smile at each other when they pass in the halls. It's fun to work there, everyone likes their job, and each employee is treated well and fairly.

category1.name: Trust & Respect
category1.definition: Workplace where trust-based relationships are highly valued and employees believe leaders are credible, honest, and competent.

category2.name: Fun & Exciting
category2.definition: Create the best employee experience that makes employees want to show up to work every day and put in their best. It keeps them enthusiastic about their tasks to ensure that the workplace environment is enjoyable

category2.name: Purpose & Meaning
category2.definition: Is the why of your organization. Purpose is what gives work meaning and is about where your company's journey is going and taking you.

category2.name: Stability
category2.definition: Built upon thoughts and assumptions that are taken for granted throughout the organization. In a complex and shifting world, the organization values a stable approach to its businesses.

category2.name: Innovation
category2.definition: An environment that promotes the exchange of ideas, creativity, and the ability to try new or different things.

category2.name: Socially Responsible
category2.definition: Is an ethical framework and suggests that an entity, be it an organization or individual, has an obligation to act for the benefit of society at large; environmental sustainability initiatives, direct philanthropic giving, ethical business practices and economic responsibility.

category2.name: Organizational Collaboration & Teamwork
category2.definition: An environment were individuals, teams, departments, divisions, and business units easily work across functional lines to share ideas, communicate, and overcome obstacles

category3.name: Process Driven
category3.definition: Is an organization that is structured, organized, managed, and measured around its primary business processes. ... The process‐driven organization supports the design and maintenance of efficient and effective business processes constitutes process culture.

category3.name: Results & Accountability Oriented
category3.definition: Works to achieve an outcome rather than focus on the process it takes to get there. It is about aligning the employee's key skills and setting plans for the delivery of certain results.

category3.name: Achievement Oriented
category3.definition: To set challenging goals throughout the organization.  There's a clear numerical goal and continuous feedback so you can measure how you're doing and change accordingly.

category3.name: Entrepreneurial Risk-Taking
category3.definition: The ability to think outside the box and take smart, calculated risks.

category3.name: Tolerance
category3.definition: Is a freely-given acceptance of differences that one sees as positive and valued and a direct contributor to success.

category3.name: Recognition & Appreciation
category3.definition: Communication between management and employees which rewards them for reaching specific goals or producing high quality results in the workplace. Recognition can be communicated through multiple channels one on one or in group settings or across the company.

category3.name: Employee Development
category3.definition: A learning environment where employees are invested in, developed, and a focus is on continued development of skillset and leadership abilities.

category3.name: Safety
category3.definition: Defined by planning, caution, and preparedness. Work environments are predictable places where people are risk-conscious and think things through carefully. Employees are united by a desire to feel protected and anticipate change; leaders emphasize being realistic and planning ahead.

category4.name: Clear Expectations
category4.definition: Team members understand where their work fits and what is expected in the total context of their team and organization's strategic plan and success goals.

category4.name: Fairness
category4.definition: Employees feel that organizational resources are allocated fairly, that organizational decisions are made in fair ways, and that their organization treats them fairly.

category4.name: Diversity
category4.definition: Diversity is a form of appreciating the variety differences in individuals and actively employing people of diverse backgrounds. The differences can be based on culture, ideas, gender, age, sex, ethnicity, sexual orientation, and social status.

category4.name: Transparency & Open Communication
category4.definition: Withhold information & no clear communication- operating in a way that creates openness between managers and employees.” Transparency implies openness, communication, and accountability.

category4.name: Empowerment
category4.definition: The belief that employees have the ability – and want to take on more responsibility and is freely given to exercise authority.

category4.name: Competitiveness
category4.definition: A competitive workplace, where everyone competes with everyone else.

category5.name: Formal Environment
category5.definition: The visible segment of the organization that is more formal dress, work environment, and communication.

category5.name: Formal & Hierarchial Structure
category5.definition: None provided

category5.name: Rules Oriented
category5.definition: The organization follows a tight set of rules, processes, and norms.

category2.definition: Quality Relationships throughout the organization. Where companies value their employees and treat them as ‘family’.  They all get along, are pleasant and happy and smile at each other when they pass in the halls. It's fun to work there, everyone likes their job, and each employee is treated well and fairly.

category2.name: Transparency & Open Communication
category2.definition: Withhold information & no clear communication- operating in a way that creates openness between managers and employees.” Transparency implies openness, communication, and accountability.

category2.name: Organizational Collaboration & Teamwork
category2.definition: An environment were individuals, teams, departments, divisions, and business units easily work across functional lines to share ideas, communicate, and overcome obstacles

category2.name: Recognition & Appreciation
category2.definition: Communication between management and employees which rewards them for reaching specific goals or producing high quality results in the workplace. Recognition can be communicated through multiple channels one on one or in group settings or across the company.

category2.name: Action Oriented
category2.definition: Action-oriented leadership involves leading by example and getting things done as an individual, team and organization.

category2.name: Fun & Exciting
category2.definition: Create the best employee experience that makes employees want to show up to work every day and put in their best. It keeps them enthusiastic about their tasks to ensure that the workplace environment is enjoyable

category3.name: Employee Development
category3.definition: A learning environment where employees are invested in, developed, and a focus is on continued development of skillset and leadership abilities.

category3.name: Purpose & Meaning
category3.definition: Is the why of your organization. Purpose is what gives work meaning and is about where your company's journey is going and taking you.

category3.name: Stability
category3.definition: Built upon thoughts and assumptions that are taken for granted throughout the organization. In a complex and shifting world, the organization values a stable approach to its businesses.

category3.name: Clear Expectations
category3.definition: Team members understand where their work fits and what is expected in the total context of their team and organization's strategic plan and success goals.

category3.name: Achievement Oriented
category3.definition: To set challenging goals throughout the organization.  There's a clear numerical goal and continuous feedback so you can measure how you're doing and change accordingly.

category3.name: Results & Accountability Oriented
category3.definition: Works to achieve an outcome rather than focus on the process it takes to get there. It is about aligning the employee's key skills and setting plans for the delivery of certain results.

category3.name: Tolerance
category3.definition: Is a freely-given acceptance of differences that one sees as positive and valued and a direct contributor to success.

category3.name: Process Driven
category3.definition: Is an organization that is structured, organized, managed, and measured around its primary business processes. ... The process‐driven organization supports the design and maintenance of efficient and effective business processes constitutes process culture.

category4.name: Innovation
category4.definition: An environment that promotes the exchange of ideas, creativity, and the ability to try new or different things.

category4.name: Diversity
category4.definition: Diversity is a form of appreciating the variety differences in individuals and actively employing people of diverse backgrounds. The differences can be based on culture, ideas, gender, age, sex, ethnicity, sexual orientation, and social status.

category4.name: Rules Oriented
category4.definition: The organization follows a tight set of rules, processes, and norms.

category4.name: Formal & Hierarchial Structure
category4.definition: None provided

category4.definition: The belief that employees have the ability – and want to take on more responsibility and is freely given to exercise authority.

category4.definition: The ability to think outside the box and take smart, calculated risks.

category5.name: Competitiveness
category5.definition: A competitive workplace, where everyone competes with everyone else.

category5.definition: The visible segment of the organization that is more formal dress, work environment, and communication.

category4.definition: Employees feel that organizational resources are allocated fairly, that organizational decisions are made in fair ways, and that their organization treats them fairly.

category4.name: Empowerment
category4.definition: The belief that employees have the ability – and want to take on more responsibility and is freely given to exercise authority.

category5.name: Rules Oriented
category5.definition: The organization follows a tight set of rules, processes, and norms.

category5.name: Diversity
category5.definition: Diversity is a form of appreciating the variety differences in individuals and actively employing people of diverse backgrounds. The differences can be based on culture, ideas, gender, age, sex, ethnicity, sexual orientation, and social status.

category5.name: Tolerance
category5.definition: Is a freely-given acceptance of differences that one sees as positive and valued and a direct contributor to success.

category1.name: Recognition & Appreciation
category1.definition: Communication between management and employees which rewards them for reaching specific goals or producing high quality results in the workplace. Recognition can be communicated through multiple channels one on one or in group settings or across the company.

category1.name: Purpose & Meaning
category1.definition: Is the why of your organization. Purpose is what gives work meaning and is about where your company's journey is going and taking you.

category1.name: Transparency & Open Communication
category1.definition: Withhold information & no clear communication- operating in a way that creates openness between managers and employees.” Transparency implies openness, communication, and accountability.

category2.name: Fun & Exciting
category2.definition: Create the best employee experience that makes employees want to show up to work every day and put in their best. It keeps them enthusiastic about their tasks to ensure that the workplace environment is enjoyable

category2.name: Organizational Collaboration & Teamwork
category2.definition: An environment were individuals, teams, departments, divisions, and business units easily work across functional lines to share ideas, communicate, and overcome obstacles

category2.name: Employee Development
category2.definition: A learning environment where employees are invested in, developed, and a focus is on continued development of skillset and leadership abilities.

category2.name: Diversity
category2.definition: Diversity is a form of appreciating the variety differences in individuals and actively employing people of diverse backgrounds. The differences can be based on culture, ideas, gender, age, sex, ethnicity, sexual orientation, and social status.

category2.name: Action Oriented
category2.definition: Action-oriented leadership involves leading by example and getting things done as an individual, team and organization.

category2.name: People Oriented
category2.definition: Quality Relationships throughout the organization. Where companies value their employees and treat them as ‘family’.  They all get along, are pleasant and happy and smile at each other when they pass in the halls. It's fun to work there, everyone likes their job, and each employee is treated well and fairly.

category3.name: Socially Responsible
category3.definition: Is an ethical framework and suggests that an entity, be it an organization or individual, has an obligation to act for the benefit of society at large; environmental sustainability initiatives, direct philanthropic giving, ethical business practices and economic responsibility.

category3.name: Trust & Respect
category3.definition: Workplace where trust-based relationships are highly valued and employees believe leaders are credible, honest, and competent.

category3.name: Tolerance
category3.definition: Is a freely-given acceptance of differences that one sees as positive and valued and a direct contributor to success.

category3.name: Innovation
category3.definition: An environment that promotes the exchange of ideas, creativity, and the ability to try new or different things.

category3.name: Fairness
category3.definition: Employees feel that organizational resources are allocated fairly, that organizational decisions are made in fair ways, and that their organization treats them fairly.

category3.name: Clear Expectations
category3.definition: Team members understand where their work fits and what is expected in the total context of their team and organization's strategic plan and success goals.

category3.name: Results & Accountability Oriented
category3.definition: Works to achieve an outcome rather than focus on the process it takes to get there. It is about aligning the employee's key skills and setting plans for the delivery of certain results.

category3.name: Empowerment
category3.definition: The belief that employees have the ability – and want to take on more responsibility and is freely given to exercise authority.

category4.name: Formal & Hierarchial Structure
category4.definition: None provided

category4.name: Competitiveness
category4.definition: A competitive workplace, where everyone competes with everyone else.

category4.name: Achievement Oriented
category4.definition: To set challenging goals throughout the organization.  There's a clear numerical goal and continuous feedback so you can measure how you're doing and change accordingly.

category4.name: Rules Oriented
category4.definition: The organization follows a tight set of rules, processes, and norms.

category4.name: Entrepreneurial Risk-Taking
category4.definition: The ability to think outside the box and take smart, calculated risks.

category4.name: Stability
category4.definition: Built upon thoughts and assumptions that are taken for granted throughout the organization. In a complex and shifting world, the organization values a stable approach to its businesses.

category5.name: Formal Environment
category5.definition: The visible segment of the organization that is more formal dress, work environment, and communication.

category5.name: Process Driven
category5.definition: Is an organization that is structured, organized, managed, and measured around its primary business processes. ... The process‐driven organization supports the design and maintenance of efficient and effective business processes constitutes process culture.

category5.name: Safety
category5.definition: Defined by planning, caution, and preparedness. Work environments are predictable places where people are risk-conscious and think things through carefully. Employees are united by a desire to feel protected and anticipate change; leaders emphasize being realistic and planning ahead.
